alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 6:45PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT WESTERN KIMBALL...SOUTHWESTERN BANNER AND SOUTHEASTERN LARAMIE COUNTIES... At 543 PM MST...An area of heavy snow was affecting portions of western Kimball...southwestern Banner and southeastern Laramie Counties. Periods of heavy snowfall will persist through 630 PM MST. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 25 mph and visibilities less than one mile. SOURCE...Radar and Webcams. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions due to slick roads and low visibilities. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Burns, Albin, Panorama Point and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 388 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 12. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas! Roads may suddenly become icy. Take extra precautions by slowing down and increasing the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you.
